summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons memorandum from the Federal Correctional Institution, dated August 10, 2019, detailing the discovery and emergency response to inmate Jeffrey Epstein's apparent suicide by hanging in his cell. It includes concerning statements from correctional officers about missed security rounds.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found unresponsive in his cell after apparently hanging himself; identified as #76318-054.

persons.name: T. Noel
persons.context: The officer who announced the medical emergency and later stated to the memorandum's author that required 3am and 5am rounds were not completed.

persons.name: M. Thomas
persons.context: The officer found performing CPR on Epstein when the author arrived; later appeared distraught and stated 'we messed up' and that no rounds were done.

connections.description: Both were correctional officers assigned to the Special Housing Unit where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
Officer Noel was responsible for the security and monitoring of inmate Epstein.
Officer Thomas was present at the scene and performed initial life-saving CPR on inmate Epstein.

events.title: Discovery of Jeffrey Epstein's Apparent Suicide
events.description: At approximately 6:33 AM, inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220 on L-tier) after apparently hanging himself. Officers and medical staff performed CPR, and he was transported to Beekman Hospital.

events.title: Missed Security Rounds Revealed
events.description: During the emergency, Officer T. Noel stated that the required 3am and 5am security rounds were not completed. Officer M. Thomas also expressed that 'we messed up' and 'we didn't do any rounds.'

events.title: Emergency Response and Transport
events.description: CPR was administered continuously from discovery until EMTs arrived at 6:43 AM. Epstein was escorted from the medical area to an ambulance at 7:10 AM and transported to Beekman Hospital.

locations: Federal Correctional Institution (Special Housing Unit, cell Z06-220 on L-tier)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at approximately 6:33 AM on August 10, 2019, after apparently hanging himself.
Correctional Officer T. Noel stated that the mandatory 3am and 5am security rounds were not completed on the night/morning of Epstein's death.
Correctional Officer M. Thomas, who performed initial CPR, was distraught and stated 'we messed up' and 'we didn't do any rounds,' suggesting a failure in protocol.
The document is an internal Bureau of Prisons memorandum that records the immediate events and officer statements surrounding Epstein's death.
Epstein was transported via ambulance to Beekman Hospital after continuous CPR was administered by prison staff and medical personnel.
